18.13: And Yoav and the people who were with him drew forward to battle with Aram, and they fled before him.
18.14: And when the sons of Ammon saw that Aram had fled, they, too, fled before Avishai, his brother, and they came to the city. And Yoav came to Jerusalem.
18.15: And when Aram saw that they had been beaten by Israel, they sent messengers and brought out Aram (who were) on the other side of the river, with Shofach, the commander of Hadarezer's army before them.
18.16: And it was told to David, and he gathered all of Israel, and he crossed the Jordan and came to them. And David arrayed himself against Aram for battle and they fought with him.
18.17: And Aram fled before Israel. And David slew of Aram [the riders of] seven hundred chariots and forty thousand footmen. And Shofach, the commander, he put to death.
18.18: And when the servants of Hadarezer saw that they were smitten before Israel, they made peace with David and served him. And Aram no longer wished to aid the sons of Ammon.

19.0: And it was, at the return of the (day of the) year of the kings' having gone out [to war against Israel] that Yoav led the army, and he destroyed the land of the children of Ammon, and he came and besieged Rabbah; but David stayed in Jerusalem. And Yoav smote Rabbah and destroyed it.
19.1: And David took the crown of Malkam [(Molech, the abomination of Ammon)] off its head (it was found to weigh a talent of gold and in it was a precious stone), and [(its idolatrous status having been nullified by Ittai the Gittite)], it was (set) on David's head. And he brought out the spoils of the city in great abundance.
19.2: And the people in it he took out and put them under saws and under sledges of iron and under axes. And thus did David do with all the cities of the children of Ammon. And David and all of the people returned to Jerusalem.
19.3: And it was after this that war broke out in Gezer with the Philistines. Then Sivchai the Chushathite smote Sippai, of those begotten by the Refaim, and they were humbled.
19.4: And there was another war with the Philistines, in which Elchanan the son of Yair smote Lachmi, the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the haft of whose spear was as (thick as) a weaver's beam.
19.5: And there was anther war in Gath where there was a man of great stature, his fingers [(the fingers of his hands and the toes of his feet)] being six and six [(i.e., six on each of the four limbs)], twenty-four (all together). And he, too, had been born to the Raphah.
19.6: And he taunted Israel. And he was smitten by Jonathan the son of Shima, the brother of David.
19.7: These were born to the Raphah in Gath. And they fell by the hand of David and by the hand of his servants.

20.0: [viz. II Samuel 24] And Satan rose against Israel and incited David to count Israel.
20.1: And David said to Yoav and to the officers of the people: Go and count Israel from Beersheva until Dan that I may know their number.
20.2: And Yoav said: May the L-rd add to His people, like them, one hundred times. Are they not, my lord the king, all servants of my lord? Why does my lord desire this [(to number the people)], for the guilt of Israel?
20.3: But the word of the king prevailed against Yoav. And Yoav went, and he traversed all of Israel, and he came to Jerusalem.
20.4: And Yoav gave the count of the people to the king. And all of Israel were a thousand thousands and one hundred thousand men that drew the sword; and Judah, five hundred thousand men that drew the sword.
20.5: And Levi and Benjamin he did not count among them, for the word of the king [(to count the people)] was repugnant to Yoav.
20.6: And this thing [(the count)] was evil in the eyes of the L-rd, and He smote Israel.
20.7: And David said to G-d: I have sinned greatly in having done this thing. And now, remove, I pray You, the sin of Your servant, for I have been very foolish.
20.8: And the L-rd spoke to Gad, David's seer, saying:
20.9: Go and speak to David: Thus has the L-rd said: I give you three [choices (corresponding to those you "gave" Saul [viz. I Samuel 26:10])]. Pick one of them and I will do it to you.
20.10: And Gad came to David and said to him: Thus has the L-rd said; take it upon you:
20.11: Either three years of famine, or three months in which you perish at the hand of your foes, the sword of your foes overtaking (you), or three days of the sword of the L-rd, pestilence in the land, and the angel of the L-rd destroying in all the border of Israel. And now, see, what answer shall I return to my Sender?
20.12: And David said to Gad: I am sorely oppressed. Let me fall now into the hand of the L-rd [(i.e., pestilence, which is entirely in the hand of the L-rd, but not sword or famine, which, to a certain extent, is mediated by man)], for His mercies are very many, but let me not fall into the hand of man.
20.13: And the L-rd sent a pestilence upon Israel. And there died of Israel seventy thousand men.
20.14: And G-d sent an angel to Jerusalem to destroy it. And, as he destroyed, the L-rd saw and He bethought Himself of the evil. And He said to the angel devastating the people: "Enough! Now stay your hand!" And the angel of the L-rd was standing by the threshing floor of Arnan the Yevusite.
20.15: And David lifted his eyes, and he saw the angel of the L-rd standing between earth and heaven with his sword drawn in his hand, stretched over Jerusalem. And David and the elders fell, covered with sackcloth, on their faces.
20.16: And David said to G-d: Was it not I who said to count the people? It is I, then, who have sinned and who have done the evil. And these sheep, what did they do? Let Your hand be against me and against my father's house, but not against Your people, for plague!
20.17: And an angel of the L-rd said to Gad to tell David that David should go up to erect an altar to the L-rd in the threshing floor of Arnan the Yevusite.
20.18: And David went up by the word of Gad that he had spoken in the name of the L-rd.
20.19: And Arnan returned, and he saw the angel. And his four sons, with him, hid themselves. (And Arnan had been threshing wheat.)
20.20: And David came towards Arnan. And Arnan looked and he saw David. And he went out from the threshing floor and he bowed down to David with his face to the ground.
20.21: And David said to Arnan: Give me the place of the threshing floor, and I will build in it an altar to the L-rd. Give it to me for its full price, and the plague will cease from the people.
20.22: And Arnan said to David: Take it for yourself, and let my lord the king do what is good in his eyes. See, I have given the oxen for burnt-offerings and the threshing tools for [fire-] wood, and the wheat for the meal-offering. I have given all.
20.23: And King David said to Arnan: No, but I will buy (it from you) at full price. For I will not take what is yours for the L-rd and offer up a burnt-offering for nothing.
20.24: And David gave to Arnan for the place shekels of gold, six hundred by weight.
20.25: And David built there an altar to the L-rd, and he offered up burnt-offerings and peace-offerings. And he called to the L-rd, and He answered him with fire from heaven on the altar of the burnt-offering.
20.26: And the L-rd spoke to the angel, and he returned his sword to its sheath.
20.27: At that time, when David saw that the L-rd had answered him in the threshing floor of Arnan the Yevusite, he sacrificed (i.e., he continued to sacrifice) there.
20.28: And the tabernacle of the L-rd, which Moses had made in the desert, and the altar of the burnt-offering, at that time, were at the high place in Giveon.
20.29: But David could not go before it to solicit G-d, for he feared the sword of the angel of the L-rd.

21.0: And David said: This is the house of the L-rd G-d and this is the altar for the burnt-offering of Israel.
21.1: And David ordered to gather the strangers who were in Eretz Yisrael, and he set up hewers to hew wrought stone to build the house of G-d.
21.2: And David prepared iron in abundance for the nails for the doors of the gates and for the couplings, and copper in abundance, without weight [i.e., beggaring weight].
21.3: And cedar trees without numbers; for the Tziddonites and the Tzorites brought cedar trees in abundance to David.
21.4: And David said: Solomon my son is young and untried and the house must be built for the L-rd, to be greatly exalted for fame and glory through all the lands. I shall prepare it for him. And David prepared (it) abundantly before his death.
21.5: And David called to Solomon his son and commanded him to build a house to the L-rd, the G-d of Israel.
21.6: And David said to Solomon his son: I — it was in my heart to build a house for the name of the L-rd my G-d.
21.7: And the word of the L-rd came to me, saying: "Blood in abundance did you spill, and great wars did you wage. You will not build a house for My name, for blood in abundance did you spill to the ground before Me.
21.8: Behold, a son will be born to you. He will be a man of repose, and I will give him rest from all of his foes roundabout. For Shlomoh will be his name. and peace [(shalom)] and quiet will I give to Israel in his days.
21.9: He will build a house in My name, and he will be a son to Me, and I [(will be)] to him a Father. And I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel forever."
21.10: Now, my son, the L-rd will be with you, and you will succeed. And you will build the house of the L-rd your G-d as He spoke of you.
21.11: But the L-rd will give you intelligence and understanding, and He will command you over Israel and (He will command you) to heed the Torah of the L-rd your G-d.
21.12: Then you will succeed, if you take heed to do the statutes and the judgments which the L-rd commanded Moses for Israel. Be strong and firm. Do not fear and do not break.
21.13: Behold, in my [(relative)] poverty, I have prepared for the house of the L-rd, gold, one hundred thousand talents, and silver, a thousand thousand talents, and copper and iron without weight, for it was (available) in abundance. And wood and stones did I prepare, and you shall add to them.
21.14: And with you in abundance are doers of work: hewers and stone masons and wood masons, and all artisans in all (kinds of) work,
21.15: for gold and silver and copper and iron, without number. Arise and do, and may the L-rd be with you.
21.16: And David charged all the officers of Israel to help Solomon his son,
21.17: [(saying:)] Is the L-rd your G-d not with you? And He will give you rest roundabout. For the L-rd has delivered the dwellers of the land into my hand. And the land has been conquered before the L-rd and before His people.
21.18: Now, set your hearts and your souls to soliciting the L-rd your G-d. And arise and build the sanctuary of the L-rd G-d, to bring the ark of the covenant of the L-rd and the holy vessels of G-d to the house to be built in the name of the L-rd.

22.0: And David was old and sated of days and he made Solomon his son king over Israel.
22.1: And he gathered together all the officers of Israel and the priests and the Levites.
22.2: And the Levites were counted from thirty years old and above, and their number by their heads was thirty-three thousand men.
22.3: Of these [(I, David, appointed)] to officiate at the service of the house of the L-rd, twenty-four thousand; and officers and judges, six thousand.
22.4: And four thousand gatekeepers and four thousand praising the L-rd with instruments that I made for (such) praise.
22.5: And David made divisions of the sons of Levi: Gershom, Kehoth and Merari:
22.6: Of the Gershunites: La'adan and Shim'i.
22.7: The sons of La'adan: the head, Yechiel, and Zetham and Yoel, three.
22.8: The sons of Shim'i: Shlomith, Chaziel and Haran. These three were heads of the fathers' houses of La'adan.
22.9: And the sons of Shim'i [(the son of Gershon)]: Yachath, Zina, and Yeush and Beriah. These, the sons of Shim'i, were four.
22.10: And Yachath was the head, and Zizah, the second. And Yeush and Beriah did not have many children and they were a father's house as one.
22.11: The sons of Kehoth: Amram, Yitzhar, Chevron and Uziel, four.
22.12: The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses. And Aaron was set apart to be sanctified as holy of holies, he and his sons forever, to burn incense before the L-rd, to minister before the L-rd and to bless [(Israel)] in His name, forever.
22.13: And Moses, the man of G-d — his sons were ascribed to the tribe of Levi.
22.14: The sons of Moses: Gershom and Eliezer.
22.15: The sons of Gershom: Shevuel, the head.
22.16: And the sons of Eliezer: Rechaviah, the head. And Eliezer had no other sons. And the sons of Rechaviah multiplied exceedingly.
22.17: The sons of Yitzhar: Shlomith, the head.
22.18: The sons of Chevron: Yeriyahu, the head; Amaryahu, the second; Yachaziel, the third; and Yekamam, the fourth.
22.19: The sons of Uziel: Michah, the head, and Yishiyah, the second.
22.20: The sons of Merari: Machli and Mushi. The sons of Machli: Elazar and Kish.
22.21: And Elazar died, and he did not have sons, but daughters, and the sons of Kish, their brethren, wed them.
22.22: The sons of Mushi: Machli and Eder and Yeremoth: three.
22.23: These are the sons of Levi by their fathers' houses, the heads of the fathers' [houses] by their count, by the number of names according to head (count), doing the work for the service of the house of the L-rd, from twenty years and above.
22.24: For David said: The L-rd G-d has given rest to His people Israel, and He has made Jerusalem His abode forever.
22.25: And, also, the Levites need not bear the tabernacle and all its vessels for its service.
22.26: For, in the latter words of David [(as opposed to the former [verse 3])], they are the number of the sons of Levi, from twenty years old and above.
22.27: For their posts were alongside the sons of Aaron for the service of the house of the L-rd, for the [(Temple)] courts and for the chambers and for the purity of all sacred (objects) and (for) performance of the service of the house of G-d.
22.28: And for the showbread and for the fine flour for the meal-offering, and for unleavened wafers and for griddle [meal-offerings] and for soaked [fine flour meal-offerings] and for all liquid measures and dry measures.
22.29: And to stand every morning [(to sing at the daily offerings)] to give thanks and praise to the L-rd, and so in the evening.
22.30: And for all the burnt-offering sacrifices to the L-rd, on Sabbaths, New Moons and festivals, according to their ordained number, always, before the L-rd.
22.31: And they shall keep the watch of the tent of meeting and the watch of the sacred (objects) and the watch of the sons of Aaron their brothers for the service of the house of the L-rd.

23.0: And of the sons of Aaron, their divisions: The sons of Aaron: Nadav and Avihu, Elazar and Ithamar.
23.1: And Nadav and Avihu died before their father. And they did not have sons, and Elazar and Ithamar served [(in their stead)].
23.2: And David divided them. And Tzaddok, of the sons of Elazar; and Achimelech, of the sons of Ithamar, were (appointed) by their numbers in their work.
23.3: And the sons of Elazar were found to be more, according to the heads of the men, than the sons of Ithamar, and they divided them: Of the sons of Elazar, heads of fathers' houses, sixteen; and of the sons of Ithamar, by their fathers' houses, eight.
23.4: And they divided them by lots [(Who would serve first; who next, etc.)], these with these. For they were (all) princes of the sanctuary and princes of G-d, of the sons of Elazar and of the sons of Ithamar.
23.5: And Shemayah the son of Nethanel the scribe, of the Levites, wrote them [(the names of the heads of houses, on ballots)] before the king and the officers and Tzaddok the priest and Achimelech the son of Evyathar, and the heads of the houses of the priests and the Levites; (every) father's house receiving an additional (father's house) for Elazar; and what was (already) held, (continuing to be) held by Ithamar.
23.6: And the first lot fell out for Yehoyariv. For Yedayah, the second;
23.7: for Charim, the third; for Se'orin, the fourth;
23.8: for Malkiyah, the fifth; for Miyamin, the sixth;
23.9: for Hakhots, the seventh; for Aviyah, the eighth;
23.10: for Yeshua, the ninth; for Shechanyahu, the tenth;
23.11: for Elyashiv, the eleventh; for Yakim, the twelfth;
23.12: for Chuppah, the thirteenth; for Yeshevav, the fourteenth;
23.13: for Bilgah, the fifteenth; for Immer, the sixteenth;
23.14: for Chezir, the seventeenth; for Hapitzetz, the eighteenth;
23.15: for Petachyah, the nineteenth; for Yechezkel, the twentieth;
23.16: for Yachin, the twenty-first; for Gamul, the twenty-second;
23.17: for Delayahu, the twenty-third; for Ma'azyahu, the twenty-fourth.
23.18: These are their numbers [i.e., the numbers of their watches] for their service, to come to the house of the L-rd as ordained, by the hand of Aaron their father, as the L-rd, the G-d of Israel, commanded him.
23.19: And, of the remaining sons of Levi [(aside from the priests and the sons of Gershon)]: Of the sons of Amram, [(the head of the house, previously called)] Shuviel, [(now,)] of the sons of Shuviel — Yechdeyahu.
23.20: Of Rechavyahu, of the sons of Rechavyahu, the head — Yishiyah.
23.21: Of the Yitzharites, Shlomoth; of the sons of Shlomoth — Yachath.
23.22: And the sons of Yeriyahu [i.e., the father's house called by that name, combined with] Amaryahu, its second, [(to be called Amaryahu)]; Yachaziel, the third; Yekamam, the fourth.
23.23: The sons of Uziel, Michah; of the sons of Michah — Shamir.
23.24: The brother of Michah, Yishiyah; of the sons of Yishiyah — Zecharyahu.
23.25: [(There were now joined to what were previously the fathers' houses of)] the sons of Merari — Machli and Mushi — [the fathers' houses of] the sons of Ya'aziyahu, his [(Merari's)] son.
23.26: [(The fathers' houses of)] the sons of Merari from Ya'aziyahu, his son: Shoham and Zakkur and Ivri.
23.27: Of Machli, Elazar; and he [(Elazar)] had no sons.
23.28: Of Kish, of the sons of Kish — Yerachme'el.
23.29: And the sons of Mushi: Machli and Eder and Yerimoth [i.e., their fathers' houses remained the same] These are the sons of the Levites by their fathers' houses [(twenty-four, corresponding to the twenty-four of the Cohanim)].
23.30: And they, too, cast lots [(for order of service)] alongside their brothers, the sons of Aaron, before King David and Tzaddok and Achimelech and the heads of the houses of the priests and the Levites — Avoth, the head [(of all the fathers' houses)] alongside his brother, the minor [i.e. no precedence in serving order being granted him because of his superior status]

24.0: And David and the officers of the host for the [sacred] service set apart [from the rest of the Levites, for service of song] the [(four)] sons of Asaph and [(the fourteen sons of)] Heiman, and [(the six sons of)] Yeduthun [(all together, twenty-four, corresponding to the twenty-four priestly watches)], who prophesied [(by the Holy Spirit)], with harps, lyres, and cymbals. And their number, skilled in their service:
24.1: Of the sons of Asaph: Zakkur and Yosef and Netanyah and Asarela, the sons of Asaph, (taught in song) by Asaph, who prophesied [(at their head)] by [mandate of] the king.
24.2: Of Yeduthun, the sons of Yeduthun: Gedalyahu and Tz'ri and Yeshayahu, Chashavyahu and Matithyahu — [(ultimately)] six, [taught] by their father Yeduthun, in the harp, who prophesied in thanks and praise to the L-rd.
24.3: Of Heiman, the sons of Heiman: Bukiyahu, Matanyahu, Uziel, Shevual, Yerimoth, Chananiah, Chanani, Eliathah, Gidalti and Romamti-Ezer, Yoshbekashah, Malothi, Hothir, Machaziyoth.
24.4: All these, sons of Heiman, the king's seer by word of G-d, to exalt the horn [of David's kingdom]. And G-d gave to Heiman fourteen sons and three daughters.
24.5: All these (taught) by their father in song, in the house of the L-rd, with cymbals, psalteries, and harps, for the service of the house of the L-rd, (as mandated) by the king — Asaph, Yeduthun, and Heiman.
24.6: And their number was, with their brethren, taught in song to the L-rd, all who knew [(this service)], two hundred and twenty-eight.
24.7: And they cast lots [(for priority in order of service)], watch for watch, small and great alike, master and disciple.
24.8: And the first lot fell out for Asaph, for Yosef [(his son)]. Gedalyahu [(the son of Yeduthun)], the second; he and his brethren and his sons — twelve [(twelve Levites for each of the twenty-four watches, giving a total of two hundred and twenty-eight [viz. 7])]
24.9: The third, Zakkur [(the son of Asaph)]; his sons and his brethren, twelve.
24.10: The fourth, for Yitzri [(Tz'ri, the son of Yeduthun)]; his sons and his brethren, twelve.
24.11: The fifth, Netanyahu; his sons and his brethren, twelve.
24.12: The sixth, Bukiyahu; his sons and his brethren, twelve.
24.13: The seventh, Yesarelah; his sons and his brethren, twelve.
24.14: The eighth, Yeshayahu; his sons and his brethren, twelve.
24.15: The ninth, Matanyahu; his sons and his brethren, twelve.
24.16: The tenth, Shim'i; his sons and his brethren, twelve.
24.17: The eleventh, Azarel; his sons and his brethren, twelve.
24.18: The twelfth, for Chashavyah; his sons and his brethren, twelve.
24.19: The thirteenth, Shuvael; his sons and his brethren, twelve.
24.20: The fourteenth, Matithyahu; his sons and his brethren, twelve.
24.21: The fifteenth, Yeremoth; his sons and his brethren, twelve.
24.22: The sixteenth, for Chananyahu; his sons and his brethren, twelve.
24.23: The seventeenth, Yoshbekashah; his sons and his brethren, twelve.
24.24: The eighteenth, for Chanani; his sons and his brethren, twelve.
24.25: The nineteenth, for Malothi; his sons and his brethren, twelve.
24.26: The twentieth, for Eliathah; his sons and his brethren, twelve.
24.27: The twenty-first, for Hothir; his sons and his brethren, twelve.
24.28: The twenty-second, for Gidalti; his sons and his brethren, twelve.
24.29: The twenty-third, for Machaziyoth; his sons and his brethren, twelve.
24.30: The twenty-fourth, for Romamti-azer; his sons and his brethren, twelve.

25.0: The divisions of the gatekeepers: Of the Korchites: Meshelemyahu the son of Korei of the sons of Asaph.
25.1: And the sons of Meshelemyahu: Zecharyahu, the first-born; Yedia'el, the second; Zevadyahu, the third; Yathniel, the fourth;
25.2: Eilam, the fifth; Yehochanan, the sixth; Elyehoeinai, the seventh;
25.3: And the sons of Oved-edom: Shemayah, the first-born; Yehozavad, the second; Yoach, the third; Sachar, the fourth; Nethanel, the fifth;
25.4: Amiel, the sixth; Issachar, the seventh; Peulathai, the eighth; for G-d had blessed him [(Oved-edom)].
25.5: And to Shemayah his son were born sons who ruled over their father's house, for they were men of valor.
25.6: The sons of Shemayah: Othni, Refael, Oved, Elzavad; his brethren, men of valor, Elihu and Semachyahu.
25.7: All of these, of the sons of Oved-edom, they, their sons and their brethren, each, strong in the service [(of keeping the gates)] — sixty-two, of Oved-edom.
25.8: And, of Meshelemyahu, sons and brethren, men of valor, eighteen.
25.9: And of Chosah of the sons of Merari, sons: Shimri, the head (although not a first-born); his father made him the head.
25.10: Chilkiyahu, the second; Tevalyahu, the third; Zecharyahu, the fourth. All the sons and brethren of Chosah, thirteen.
25.11: To these [(as heads)] were the divisions of the gatekeepers, to the heads of the men, watches [viz. 18] alongside their brethren [(the singers)], to serve in the house of the L-rd.
25.12: And they cast lots for small and great alike, by the house of their fathers, for each gate.
25.13: And the lot for the east [gate] fell for Shelemyahu. And (for) Zecharyahu his son, a counselor in wisdom, they cast lots, and his lot fell for the north.
25.14: [The lot fell] for Oved-edom, for the south, and for his sons, (for) the house of Asuppim.
25.15: For Shupim and Chosah, for the west, near the Shalecheth gate on the ascending road, in rotating watches.
25.16: In the east, the Levites were six [groups]; in the north, four for the day; in the south, four for the day; and for Asuppim, two [for one gate] and two [for the other].
25.17: For the Parbar in the west, four [groups] on the road [(to the Parbar)] and two for the Parbar [itself (twenty-four watches all together)].
25.18: These are the divisions of the gatekeepers for the Korchites and for the sons of Merari.
25.19: And (of) the Levites, Achiyah (was appointed) over the treasuries [for the maintenance] of the house of G-d and over the treasuries of the holy things [i.e., the sacrifices].
25.20: The sons of La'adan, the sons of the Gershonites: Of La'adan, the heads of the fathers' [houses] of La'adan, the Gershonite — Yechieli.
25.21: The sons of Yechieli: Zeitham and Yoel his brother, over the treasuries of the house of the L-rd.
25.22: [(And there were also treasurers)] of the Amramites, the Yitzharites, the Chevronites, and the Uzielites.
25.23: And Shevuel the son of Gershom the son of Moses was the head of the treasuries.
25.24: And his [Shevuel's] brothers of [the seed of] Eliezer: Rechavyahu, his [Eliezer's] son and Yeshayahu, his [Rechavyahu's] son, and Yoram, his son, and Zichri, his son and Shelomith, his son.
25.25: This is Shelomoth and his brothers (who were) over all the treasuries of the holy things that were consecrated by King David and the heads of the fathers' [houses] of the officers of the thousands and the hundreds and the commanders of the army.
25.26: From the wars and from the spoils they consecrated [(these things)] to strengthen the house of the L-rd.
25.27: And [(there was deposited in these treasuries)] all that was consecrated by Samuel the seer and Saul the son of Kish and Avner the son of Ner and Yoav the son of Tzeruyah. All that was consecrated was [reposited in the treasuries] through Shelomith and his brethren.
25.28: Of the Yitzharites, Kenanyahu and his sons, for the work outside [the city for Temple needs], over Israel, as officers and judges.
25.29: Of the Chevronites, Chashavyahu and his brethren, one thousand and seven hundred for the overseeing of Israel from across the Jordan westwards for all the work of the [house of the] L-rd and for the service of the king.
25.30: Of the Chevronites, Yeriah the head of the Chevronites, by its genderings, by [fathers'] houses. In the fortieth year of David's reign they were inquired after, and there were found among them men of valor in Yazer-gilead.
25.31: And his [(Yeriah's)] brethren, valiant men, two thousand and seven hundred, (among them) heads of fathers' [houses]. And King David appointed them over the Reuvenites and the Gadites and the half-tribe of Menasheh for every matter of [the house of] G-d and for (every) matter of the king.

26.0: And the children of Israel, by their number, [(among them)] heads of the fathers' houses and officers of thousands and hundreds, and their supervisors, who ministered before the king for all functions of the divisions, one coming in, the other going out, month by month for all the months of the year — one division, twenty-four thousand (men).
26.1: Over the first division, for the first month, Yashavam the son of Zavdiel, and his division, twenty-four thousand.
26.2: [(Yashavam was)] of the sons of Peretz (and he was) the head of all the officers of the host, [(and he was specifically designated)] for the first month.
26.3: And over the division of the second month, Dodai the Achochite, and his division adjutant, Umikloth the leader, and, his division, twenty-four thousand.
26.4: The third officer of the host for the third month, Benayahu the son of Yehoyada the priest, the head; and his division, twenty-four thousand.
26.5: He, Benayahu, was the stalwart of the officers. And, over the officers, and his division adjutant, was Amizavad, his son.
26.6: The fourth, for the fourth month, Asahel, the brother of Yoav, and Zevadyah his son after him; and his division, twenty-four thousand.
26.7: The fifth, for the fifth month, the chief, Shamhuth the Yizrachite; and his division, twenty-four thousand.
26.8: The sixth, for the sixth month, Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite; and his division, twenty-four thousand.
26.9: The seventh, for the seventh month, Cheletz the Plonite of the sons of Ephraim; and his division, twenty-four thousand.
26.10: the eighth, for the eighth month, Sibchai and Chushathite of the Zarchites; and his division, twenty-four thousand.
26.11: The ninth, for the ninth month, Aviezer the Anthothite of the Benjamites, and his division, twenty-four thousand.
26.12: The tenth, for the tenth month, Maharai the Netofathite of the Zarchites; and his division, twenty-four thousand.
26.13: The eleventh, for the eleventh month, Benayah the Pirathonite of the sons of Ephraim, and his division, twenty-four thousand.
26.14: The twelfth, for the twelfth month, Cheldai the Netofathite of [(the sons of)] Othniel; and his division, twenty-four thousand.
26.15: And over the tribes of Israel: of the Reuvenites, the leader, Eliezer the son of Zichri; of the Shimonites, Shefatyahu the son of Ma'achah;
26.16: of the Levites, Chashavyah the son of Kemuel; of Aaron. Tzaddok;
26.17: of Judah, Elihu of the brothers of David; of Issachar, Omri the son of Michael;
26.18: of Zevulun, Yishmayahu the son of Ovadyahu; of Naftali, Yerimoth the son of Azriel;
26.19: of the sons of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Azazyahu; of the half-tribe of Menasheh, Yoel the son of Pedayahu;
26.20: of the half (tribe) of Menasheh in Gilead, Yiddo the son of Zecharyahu; of Benjamin, Ya'asiel the son of Avner;
26.21: of Dan, Azarel the son of Yerocham. These are the officers of the tribes of Israel.
26.22: And David did not count their number from twenty years and below, for the L-rd had spoken to multiply Israel like the stars of the heavens [(which cannot be counted)].
26.23: Yoav the son of Tzeruyah began to count, but he did not finish. And there was, because of this, wrath over Israel. And the number [(that he counted)] did not amount to the number in the chronicles of King David.
26.24: And over the treasuries of the king, Azmaveth the son of Adiel. And over the stores in the field, in the cities, in the villages and in the towers, Yehonathan the son of Uziyahu.
26.25: And over the field workers for the work of the soil, Ezri the son of K'luv.
26.26: And over the vineyards, Shim'i the Ramathite. And over the vineyards for the wine stores, Zavdi the Shifmite.
26.27: And over the olive trees and the sycamore trees in the lowland, Ba'al Chagan the Gederite. And over the oil stores, Yoash.
26.28: And over the cattle grazing in Sharon, Shitrai the Sharonite. And over the cattle in the valleys, Shafat the son of Adlai.
26.29: And over the camels, Ovil the Ishmaelite. And over the she-asses, Yechdahu the Hameronothite.
26.30: And over the flocks, Yaziz the Hagarite. All these, the property officers of King David.
26.31: And Jonathan, David's uncle, counselor, a man of understanding and a scribe. And Yechiel the son of Chachmoni, with the sons of the king [(to teach them)].
26.32: And Achitofel, counselor to the king. And Chushai the Arkite, the king's companion.
26.33: And after [(the death of)] Achitofel, Yehoyada the son of Benayahu and Evyathar. And the king's commander in chief, Yoav.

27.0: And David assembled all the officers of Israel: the officers of the tribes and the officers of the divisions ministering unto the king, and the officers of the thousands, and the officers of the hundreds and the officers of all the property and the livestock of the king and his sons, with the eunuchs and the stalwarts and all the men of valor, in Jerusalem.
27.1: And King David rose to his feet and said: Hear me, my brothers and my people. It is in my heart to build a house of rest for the ark of the L-rd and for the footstool of our G-d, and I have prepared [all that is needed] to build (it).
27.2: But G-d said to me: Do not build a house to My name, for you are a man of war and you have spilled blood.
27.3: And the L-rd G-d of Israel chose me of all of my father's house to be king over Israel forever. For in Judah He chose a leader; and in the house of Judah, my father's house; and of the sons of my father, me did He want to make king over Israel.
27.4: And of all of my sons (for many sons did the L-rd give me) He chose Solomon my son to sit on the throne of the kingdom of the L-rd over Israel.
27.5: And He said to me: Solomon your son, he will build My house and My courts. For I have chosen him for Me as a son, and I shall be to him as a Father.
27.6: And I have established his kingdom forever if he will strengthen himself to do My mitzvoth and My judgments as of this day.
27.7: And now, before the eyes of all of Israel, the congregation of the L-rd [(I exhort you:)] Keep and seek all the mitzvoth of the L-rd your G-d so that you inherit the good land and so that you bequeath it to your sons after you forever.
27.8: And you, Solomon, my son, know the G-d of your father and serve Him with a whole heart and with a willing spirit. For the L-rd seeks out all hearts and He understands the inclination of all thoughts. If you seek Him, He will be found for you; and if you leave Him, He will forsake you forever.
27.9: See, now, that the L-rd has chosen you to build a house as a sanctuary [for Him]. Be strong and do!
27.10: And David gave to Solomon his son the plans for the Ulam [(the entrance hall)] and its houses and its treasuries and its upper stories and its inner chambers and the house of the ark cover [i.e., the holy of holies].
27.11: And the plans of all that was with him by the [Holy] Spirit, for the courts of the house of the L-rd and for all the chambers roundabout, for the treasuries of the house of G-d [(for Temple maintenance)] and for the treasuries of the holies [i.e., for communal sacrifices].
27.12: And for the divisions of the priests and the Levites and for the work of the service of the house of the L-rd and for all the vessels of the service of the house of the L-rd.
27.13: For gold: the weight of the gold for all of the vessels by their respective service. For all of the silver vessels, by weight, for all of the vessels by their respective service.
27.14: And the weight [of gold] for the golden candelabra and their golden lamps, by the weight of each candelabrum and its lamps. And for the silver candelabra, by weight, for the candelabrum and its lamps, according to the respective service of each candelabrum.
27.15: And the gold, the weight for the showbread tables for each table and silver for the silver tables.
27.16: And (for) the forks and the basins and the staves, of pure gold. And for the golden cups, by weight, for each cup; and for the silver cups, by weight, for each cup.
27.17: And for the incense altar, refined gold, by weight. And for the design of the chariot, the cherubs of gold, spreading out (their wings) and covering the ark of the covenant of the L-rd, all the works of the plan.
27.18: All in writing, imparted to me by the hand of the L-rd, all the works of the plan.
27.19: And David said to Solomon his son: Be strong and firm and do. Do not fear and do not break. For the L-rd G-d, my G-d is with you. He will not let go of you and will not leave you until the completion of all the work of the service of the house of the L-rd.
27.20: And, behold, the divisions of the priests and the Levites for all the service of the house of G-d. And with you, in every (kind of) work, all who volunteer (their services) in wisdom for every (kind of) service. And the officers and the whole people (are at your service) for all that you bid.

28.0: And King David said to the entire congregation: Solomon my son is [only] one. G-d has chosen him, young and untried. And the work is great. For the palace [i.e., the Temple] is not for man, but for the L-rd G-d.
28.1: And with all my strength I prepared for the house of my G-d. Gold for the (things of) gold, silver for the silver, copper for the copper, iron for the iron, wood for the wood, onyx stones and (stones) for setting, carbuncle stones and embroidery, and all precious stones, and marble stones in abundance.
28.2: And more, in my desire for the house of my G-d — I have a treasure of gold and silver — I gave (it) for the house of my G-d, over and above all that I prepared for the holy house.
28.3: Three thousand talents of gold of the gold of Ophir. And seven thousand talents of refined silver to overlay the walls of the houses.
28.4: The gold for the gold and the silver for the silver and (materials) for all the work, in the hands of the craftsmen. And who [(of you the people)] will volunteer to fill his hand today for the [house of] the L-rd?
28.5: And there volunteered, the officers of the fathers' [houses] and the officers of the tribes of Israel and the officers of the thousands and the hundreds and the officers of the king's service.
28.6: And they gave for the service of the house of G-d: gold, five thousand talents, and ten thousand drachmas; silver, ten thousand talents; and copper, eighteen thousand talents; and iron, a hundred thousand talents.
28.7: And those with whom stones were found gave (them) to the treasury of the house of the L-rd by the hand of Yechiel the Gershunite.
28.8: And the people rejoiced in their giving, for they gave with a full heart to the L-rd. And King David, too, rejoiced greatly.
28.9: And David blessed the L-rd before the eyes of the entire congregation, and David said: Blessed are You, O L-rd, G-d of Israel, our Father, forever and ever.
28.10: Yours, O L-rd, is the greatness and the strength and the glory and the triumph and the majesty. For all in heaven and earth (is Yours). Yours, O L-rd, is the kingdom and the exaltation over every head.
28.11: And wealth and honor (come) from before You. And You rule over all. And in Your hand is power and strength. And in Your hand (is the power) to exalt and strengthen all.
28.12: And now, our G-d, we thank You, and we praise the name of Your glory.
28.13: For who am I and who are my people that we summon strength to give like this? For all is from You, and from Your hand have we given to You.
28.14: For strangers are we before You, and sojourners like all of our fathers. Like a shadow are our days upon the earth, and there is no hope [(against death)].
28.15: O L-rd our G-d, all this store which we have brought forward to build to You a house for Your holy name — it is from Your hand, and all is Yours.
28.16: And I know, my G-d, that You sound the heart and desire what is just. I, in the justness of my heart, have donated all these (things). And now, Your people who are found here, I have seen in joy donating to You.
28.17: O L-rd, G-d of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, our fathers, preserve this forever, the inclination of the thoughts of the hearts of Your people, and ready their hearts unto You.
28.18: And to Solomon my son give a whole heart to keep Your mitzvoth, Your testimonies, and Your statutes, and to do all (that is needed), and to build the palace [i.e., the Temple] that I have readied.
28.19: And David said to all the congregation: Bless the L-rd your G-d. And all the congregation blessed the L-rd, the G-d of their fathers. And they knelt and prostrated themselves to the L-rd and to the king.
28.20: And they sacrificed peace-offerings to the L-rd, and they offered up burnt-offerings to the L-rd on the morrow of that day: a thousand bulls, a thousand rams, a thousand lambs, and their libations. And peace-offerings in abundance (were offered) by all of Israel.
28.21: And they ate and they drank before the L-rd on that day with great joy. And they crowned Solomon the son of David as king a second time [viz. I Kings 1:39], and they anointed him to the L-rd as leader, and (they anointed) Tzaddok as [high-] priest.
28.22: And Solomon sat on the throne of the L-rd as king in place of David, his father. And he prospered, and all of Israel heeded him.
28.23: And all the officers and the stalwarts and also all the sons of King David granted obeisance to King Solomon.
28.24: And the L-rd aggrandized Solomon before the eyes of all of Israel and He conferred upon him royal majesty, (the likes of) which had been accorded no other king over Israel before him.
28.25: And David the son of Yishai reigned over all of Israel.
28.26: And the days that he reigned over Israel were forty years. In Chevron he reigned for seven years and in Jerusalem he reigned for thirty-three years.
28.27: And he died in a good old age, sated with days, wealth, and honor. And Solomon his son reigned in his place.
28.28: And the events of (the reign of) King David, the earlier and the later, are recorded in the words of Samuel the seer and in the words of Nathan the prophet and in the words of Gad the seer,
28.29: with (an account of) all his kingdom and his might and of the times that passed over him and over Israel and over all the kingdoms of the lands.
